2.	[SUPPLIER company name], a company incorporated in [England and Wales] (company number [number]) whose registered office is at [address] (the Supplier), (each a Party and together the Parties). BACKGROUND

The University is a higher education institution based in Northampton, which offers students undergraduate and postgraduate courses and university degrees. The Supplier is [description]. The University wishes to engage the Supplier to supply Occupational Health services in accordance with this Agreement.

The Parties agree as follows: interpretation In this Agreement the following terms have the following meanings: Affected Party	as defined in clause 23.1; Affiliate	(a) 	as regards the University: each of its Subsidiaries from time to time; and

(b) 	as regards the Supplier: its ultimate holding company and each of its ultimate holding company’s other Subsidiaries from time to time; Applicable Policies 	the policies and procedures of the University described in Schedule 5 including changes and additions identified under clause 11.2;

Applicable Law	all laws, regulations, directives, statutes, subordinate legislation, common law and civil codes of any jurisdiction, all judgments, orders, notices, instructions, decisions and awards of any court or competent authority or tribunal, all codes of practice having force of law, statutory guidance, regulatory policy or guidance and industry codes of practice;

Associated Parties	as defined in clause 41.1; Background IPR	as defined in clause 29.1.1; Business Continuity Plan	the plan required under clause 22; Business Day	any day which is not a Saturday, Sunday or a public or bank holiday in England;
Data Protection Policies	as defined in paragraph 1.1.2 of Schedule 9; CEDR	as defined in clause 46.3.1; Change	a variation to the Services or to any other terms of this Agreement;
Change Control Note or CCN	as defined in paragraph 1.1 of Schedule 6; Change Control Procedure	the Change control procedure in Schedule 6; Change Request 	as defined in paragraph 3.1 of Schedule 6;

Charges	the charges for the Services as calculated in accordance with Schedule 3; Commencement Date	1 February 2025; Comparison Sample	as defined in paragraph 1.1 of Schedule 8; Confidential Information	as defined in clause 30.1;

Contract Managers	the University’s Contract Manager and the Supplier’s Contract Manager; Contract Term	the period during which this Agreement is in force and effect as determined by clause 4; Control 	as defined in clause 34.2.1;

Corrupt Act	as defined in clause 41.1; Data Protection Law	as defined in paragraph 1.1.2 of Schedule 9; Data Subject	as defined in paragraph 1.1.1 of Schedule 9; Data Third Parties 	as defined in paragraph 2.4.1 of Schedule 9;

Deliverables	all documents (being anything in which information of any description is recorded in any form and media), products and materials created or developed by or on behalf of the Supplier or Supplier Personnel as part of or in connection with the Services or this Agreement (including any specified in Schedule 1) and all modifications and enhancements to them made by or on behalf of the Supplier or Supplier Personnel;

Disclosing Party	as defined in clause 30.1.1(a); Dispute	any dispute, disagreement or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes and claims);

Dispute Notice			             as defined in clause 46.1; Employment Liabilities	as defined in clause 16.1.2; Employment Regulations	as defined in clause 16.1.3; Estimate	as defined in paragraph 4.3 of Schedule 6;

Extension Period	as defined in clause 4.2; Force Majeure Event	any cause affecting the performance by a Party of any of its obligations under this Agreement which is beyond its reasonable control and which, by its nature, could not have been foreseen or, if foreseeable, was unavoidable (but excluding the consequences of any failure by the Supplier to comply with clause 22, any duty to comply with Applicable Law, any cause which is attributable to the Party’s or its Affiliates’ wilful act or negligence, any cause which merely increases its cost of performing its obligations, any industrial dispute relating to the Supplier or Supplier Personnel or any analogous failure in the Supplier’s or Supplier Personnel’s supply chain);

Foreground IPR	as defined in clause 29.1.2; Good Industry Practice	the exercise of that degree of skill, diligence, prudence, foresight and operating practice which, at the relevant time, would reasonably and ordinarily be expected from a skilled and experienced person engaged in the same or a similar business;

Good Value	as defined in paragraph 1.1 of Schedule 8; Initial Term	as defined in clause 4.3.1; Intellectual Property Rights	any of the following rights existing in any part of the world: all patents, utility models, rights to inventions, plant variety rights, copyright and neighbouring and related rights, moral rights, rights in designs, semiconductor topography rights, trade and service marks, trade names, logos, rights in get-up and trade dress, goodwill and the right to sue for passing off or unfair competition, domain name registrations, database rights and rights in  information (including Know-How) and all other intellectual property rights, in each case whether registered or unregistered; applications to register any of those rights; rights to apply for and be granted renewals or extensions of, and rights to claim priority from, any of those rights; and any similar or equivalent rights;

IPR Claim	as defined in clause 29.1.3; Know-How	information concerning technology or technical processes, trade secrets and other information (including paper, electronically stored data, magnetic media, film and microfilm) including information comprising or relating to drawings, designs, tables, concepts, data, discoveries, formulae, ideas, inventions, improvements, developments, materials, methods, specifications, techniques, products, processes, procedures, market forecasts, lists and particulars of customers and suppliers, designs for experiments and tests and results of experimentation and testing, reports and information contained in submissions to and information from ethics committees and regulatory authorities;

Liabilities	all losses, claims, damages, liabilities, fines, interest, penalties, costs, charges, expenses, demands and legal and other professional costs (calculated on a full indemnity basis); Mediation Notice 	as defined in clause 46.1;

Model Mediation Procedure	as defined in clause 46.3.1; 
or MMP Personal Data	as defined in paragraph 1.1.1 of Schedule 9; Processing 	as defined in clause 1.1.1 of Schedule 9; Proposal	as defined in clause 3.3;

Recipient Party	as defined in clause 30.1.1(a); Related Persons	as defined in clause 30.1.2; Replacement Provider	a provider (which may include the University, any of its Affiliates or any third party) of any services which the University requires to replace the Services or any of them following the expiry or termination of all or part of this Agreement;

Service Credits	any service credits that are payable in respect of a failure to meet any of the Service Levels; Service Failure	a failure by the Supplier to supply the Services in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement and any other incident which this Agreement deems to be a Service Failure;

Service Levels	the minimum standard of performance required of the Services as set out in Schedule 2; Services	(a)	the services to be supplied by the Supplier under this Agreement, as set out in Part 1 of Schedule 1;
(b)	all activities, functions and services necessary for the proper supply of, ancillary to or customarily included as part of, the services as set out in Part 1 of Schedule 1;

(c)	all Deliverables which are to be supplied by the Supplier under this Agreement; (d)	the supervisory services required to ensure the Services are supplied properly; and (e)	any other services which the University agrees to take from the Supplier under or in connection with this Agreement;
Subsidiary	as regards a company or other person, each company or person: (a)      in which it, either directly or indirectly, owns: i)	50% or more of the entire issued share capital; or
ii)	a majority of the voting rights; or (b)	over which it, either directly or indirectly, has the power to secure the manner in which the company’s or person’s affairs are conducted,

(and where indirectly means through a chain of ownership or control, of the sort described in (a) or (b), which links it to the company or person concerned); Supplier Background IPR	as defined in clause 29.1.4;

Supplier Equipment	as defined in clause 17.6; Supplier Personnel	the Supplier’s Contract Manager, any Key Personnel, consultants, agents, contractors and subcontractors of the Supplier engaged from time to time to supply the Services and/or perform this Agreement and the employees, staff, other workers, agents and consultants who are engaged by the Supplier or by any of the foregoing in the supply of the Services and/or the performance of this Agreement;

Supplier’s Contract Manager	the Supplier's representative appointed in accordance with clause 18.1; Supply Threat	as defined in clause 22.1; Tax Liability	as defined in clause 28.5; University Data 	all data or records of whatever nature in whatever form relating to the University or any of its Affiliates, its or their operations, facilities, assets, employees, clients or otherwise relating to its or their business, whether subsisting at the Commencement Date, or created or processed in connection with this Agreement or as provided by the University or any of its Affiliates to the Supplier in connection with this Agreement and the University Data shall include all Confidential Information of the university and its Affiliates and the University Personal Data;

University Parties	as defined in clause 16.1.1; University Personal Data 	all Personal Data which is owned, controlled or processed by the University or any of its Affiliates and which is provided by or on behalf of the University or any of its Affiliates to the Supplier or which comes into the possession of the Supplier as a result of or in connection with the supply of the Services and/or performance of this Agreement;

University Property	the University’s or its Affiliates’ property, plant, tools, materials, systems, hardware or other equipment; University's Contract Manager	the University's representative, appointed in accordance with clause 18.3; University’s Premises	the premises of the University or its Affiliates;

User	as defined in paragraph 1.1 of Schedule 8; User Group	as defined in paragraph 1.1 of Schedule 8; Valid Invoice	as defined in clause 26.4; and VAT	value added tax chargeable under the Value Added Tax Act 1994 and any other tax of any jurisdiction based on sales of goods or services such as sales taxes and any similar, replacement or additional tax.

In this Agreement, unless otherwise specified, a reference to: the singular includes the plural and vice versa and any gender includes the others; a person includes natural persons, firms, companies, corporations, states and associations wherever and however incorporated or established;

clause or Schedule is to a clause of, or Schedule to, this Agreement and references to paragraphs are to paragraphs of the Schedule in which they appear; this Agreement is to this agreement as varied from time to time;

a document is to that document as modified or replaced from time to time; legislation or Applicable Law is to that legislation or Applicable Law as amended, extended or re-enacted from time to time and includes all subordinate legislation made under it;

including, include, in particular or any similar terms shall be construed as illustrative only and shall not limit the sense of the words preceding those terms; writing or written includes email but not faxes;

days, months or years is to calendar days, months or years; and from means from and including when referring to periods. An obligation of any Party to indemnify any person against a Liability is to be construed as including an obligation to indemnify and hold harmless and keep that person indemnified on demand and in full from and against each Liability incurred as a result of suffering, defending or settling a claim alleging that Liability.

An obligation on the Supplier to do, or refrain from doing, any act or thing shall include an obligation on the Supplier to procure that the Supplier Personnel (and its Affiliates, to the extent they are engaged in the supply of the Services also do, or refrain from doing, such act or thing and the Supplier shall be liable for all acts and omissions of the Supplier Personnel and its Affiliates as if they were its own acts or omissions.

Without prejudice to clause 1.6, this Agreement and the Services are for the benefit of the University and its Affiliates. Accordingly, unless the context otherwise dictates, references to: the Services being supplied to, or other activities being provided for, the University,

any benefits, warranties, indemnities and rights granted or provided to the University, any licence being granted to the University, and the business, operations, customers, assets, Intellectual Property Rights, agreements or other property of the University,

shall be construed as if reference to the University were to each of the University and its Affiliates. Obligations of the University shall not be interpreted as obligations of any Affiliate of the University.

Headings are for convenience only and shall not affect the interpretation of this Agreement. The Schedules form part of this Agreement and shall have effect as if set out in full in the main body of this Agreement. Any reference to this Agreement includes the Schedules.

Any reference to the effect that breach of a particular provision of this Agreement shall be deemed to be a material breach shall not be taken to mean that the breach of any other provision of this Agreement shall not be a material breach.
If there is any conflict between any of the sections of this Agreement, they shall be applied in the following order of precedence: first the clauses; then the Schedules; and

lastly any other document referred to in this Agreement. The summary sheet attached at the front of this Agreement is for convenience only and does not form part of, and shall not affect the interpretation of, this Agreement.

No terms or conditions endorsed upon, delivered with or contained in the Supplier’s proposal, quotation, acknowledgement or acceptance of order, specification or other document, or which are implied by trade, custom, practice or course of dealing, will form part of this Agreement and the Supplier waives any right which it otherwise might have to rely on such terms and conditions.
SUPPLY OF THE SERVICES With effect from the Commencement Date, and subject to and in accordance with this Agreement, the University appoints the Supplier to supply: the Services to the University;

The Supplier’s appointment is exclusive and nor does it guarantee any level of business for the Supplier. PRE-CONTRACTUAL INFORMATION The Supplier agrees and acknowledges that: it has been provided with and understands all the information needed to assess the scope of the University’s requirements for the Services;

it has taken into account the condition of all assets, premises and facilities, and is aware of the composition, size and requirements of all user groups, relevant to the performance of this Agreement and all applicable constraints; and

it is aware of and is able to meet all of the University’s requirements for the Services as communicated to the Supplier before the Commencement Date, and accordingly, the Supplier may not at any time claim any extension of time, relief from its contractual obligations or charge for any additional costs or time incurred on the basis that it was unaware of the scope and extent of the University’s requirements or of the matters agreed and acknowledged by it in clauses 3.1.1 to 3.1.3.

The Supplier represents, warrants and undertakes that all information it, its advisers and the Supplier Personnel have provided to the University before entering into this Agreement is true, complete and accurate and acknowledges that the University is entering into this Agreement in reliance on that information.

In this clause 3, Proposal means the tender response, proposal, information and/or materials which the Supplier has presented to the University and on the basis of which it has been appointed to provide the Services, a copy of which is attached in Appendix [  ].

DURATION Option 1 – Fixed Term with extension option This Agreement shall commence on the Commencement Date and (unless terminated earlier in accordance with this Agreement) shall continue until 31 January 2028 when it shall expire, unless it is extended by the University in accordance with clause 4.2.
orders Not less than five days before the beginning of each month during the Contract Term, the University shall give the Supplier its Order for that month. Each Order shall:

be given in writing or, if given orally, shall be confirmed in writing within two Business Days; specify the type and quantity of Goods ordered; and unless the Parties agree that the University may specify the date and location after placing the Order, specify the Delivery Date by which the Goods ordered are to be delivered, and the Delivery Location. If the Delivery Date and/or Delivery Location are to be specified after the placing of an Order, the University shall give the Supplier reasonable advance notice of the relevant information.

The Supplier shall assign an Order Number to each Order received from the University and notify such Order Numbers to the University. Each party shall use the relevant Order Number in all subsequent correspondence relating to the Order.

MANUFACTURE, QUALITY AND PACKING GOODS – Not Used DELIVERY OF GOODS – NOT USED ACCEPTANCE AND DEFECTIVE GOODS – not used GENERAL SERVICES OBLIGATIONS The Supplier shall: supply the Services and achieve the Milestones in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement including Schedule 1;

apply such time, attention, resources, trained personnel and skill in performing its obligations under this Agreement as may be necessary for the due and proper performance of similar obligations by an expert supplier;

supply the Services efficiently and with the optimum use of resources so as to supply the Services at the lowest reasonably obtainable overall cost to the University; supply the Services in accordance with all reasonable instructions and directions given by the University;

ensure that, when supplying the Services, it does not interfere with the activities of the University or its Affiliates or their respective employees, agents, suppliers or customers; ensure that all written information given by it to the University is complete and accurate when given and remains so in all material respects;

act in the best interests of the University and not undertake any activities which may in any way harm the University’s or its Affiliates’ business or reputation; avoid conflicts of interests arising and promptly notify the University of any that do arise;

obtain and maintain in full force all necessary consents, approvals, authorisations, licences and permissions which are required for it to perform its obligations under this Agreement; on request, provide reasonable co-operation to the University and its Affiliates and with the University’s and its Affiliates’ other suppliers, in order to ensure the integration, interoperability and smooth and seamless alignment of the Services with other connected services; and

immediately notify the University of any claim or allegation that the Supplier is or may be in breach of any Applicable Law. The University will not be treated as having accepted any Deliverable until it has been given a reasonable opportunity to inspect it.

SERVICE STANDARD The Supplier shall supply the Services: so as to attain the Service Levels as a minimum; in a timely, professional and efficient manner; and in accordance with: all Applicable Law; and

Good Industry Practice. The University's rights under this Agreement are in addition to any terms implied in its favour by any statute or other Applicable Laws. The Supplier represents, warrants and undertakes to the University on an ongoing basis that all Deliverables shall be:

free from defects in design, materials and workmanship; and suitable for the purposes indicated in or to be reasonably inferred from Schedule 1. The Supplier shall promptly notify the University of any complaint or other matter which comes to its attention and which might reasonably give rise to the University incurring any Liability or which may result in any adverse publicity for the University.

POLICY COMPLIANCE The Supplier shall comply in all respects with the Applicable Policies. The University shall make available to the Supplier access to or copies of all Applicable Policies. The University shall advise the Supplier of any change to an Applicable Policy and of any additional Applicable Policy, which the University may from time to time adopt so far as that change or addition affects the rights or duties of the Supplier under this Agreement.
To the extent that an Applicable Policy is phrased to apply to the University personnel, the Supplier shall comply with it as if it were one of the University’s personnel.

SERVICE FAILURE If there is a Service Failure, or it is reasonably foreseeable that there may be one, the Supplier shall immediately notify the University of the nature of the Service Failure and the action that it has taken or proposes to take to minimise its adverse effects. Such notification shall be in writing or, if given orally, shall be confirmed in writing as soon as reasonably practicable.

The Supplier shall minimise the impact of any Service Failure and resume normal supply of the Services as soon as possible.  If a Service Failure is of sufficient severity, this shall include the Supplier implementing the Business Continuity Plan to minimise or avoid any disruption to the Services and to the University.

Throughout the period of any Service Failure, the Supplier shall keep the University advised of the status of all remedial efforts being undertaken by it or on its behalf with respect to the underlying cause and effects of the Service Failure.

Following any Service Failure occurring the Supplier shall: investigate the underlying causes and take all necessary steps to prevent it from recurring; and if requested by the University: produce a comprehensive remediation plan for the University’s approval which sets out, to the University’s reasonable satisfaction, the steps that the Supplier shall take to ensure that further occurrences of the Service Failure and its consequences are kept to an absolute minimum; and

make such modifications and otherwise take such steps (at no cost to the University) as will ensure that the Services comply in full with this Agreement. The Supplier may not charge the University for any work carried out by it in connection with remedying a Service Failure or for Services which are not supplied properly because of a Service Failure.

reporting and consequences of service failures The Supplier shall monitor and report its performance against the Service Levels in accordance with Schedule 2. If the Supplier fails to attain a Service Level or to achieve a Milestone then:
it shall be deemed to be a Service Failure; and where under Schedule 2 a Service Credit is payable for the failure, that Service Credit shall be paid by the Supplier in accordance with clause 13.3.

The Supplier shall pay all Service Credits to the University in the form of a credit note by the twentieth Business Day after the date it incurs the Service Credit (or, if no further Charges are due to the Supplier, as a debt payable to the University immediately on incurring the Service Credit).

CHANGE Changes shall be managed and approved under the Change Control Procedure and shall not be valid unless made in accordance with the Change Control Procedure. SUPPLIER personnel The Supplier shall ensure that:

sufficient Supplier Personnel are available at all times to supply the Services in accordance with this Agreement; all Supplier Personnel have the necessary skills, experience and qualifications to supply the Services (including any specific roles allocated by the Supplier) in accordance with this Agreement. The Supplier shall be responsible for all costs, fees, expenses and charges for any training that may be necessary or required for any Supplier Personnel to supply the Services; and

its contracts and arrangements with Supplier Personnel are and remain consistent with, and facilitate the performance of the Supplier’s obligations under, clause 29. The Supplier shall replace any of the Supplier Personnel who the University reasonably decides have failed to carry out their duties in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement or are in breach of any Applicable the University Policies.

Following the removal of any of the Supplier Personnel for any reason, the Supplier shall ensure the person concerned is replaced promptly with another person with the necessary training and skills to meet the requirements of the Services and that there is an adequate handover between the individuals involved, all at no cost to the University.

The Supplier shall use all reasonable endeavours to ensure continuity of personnel and to ensure that the turnover rate of the Supplier Personnel is no higher than the prevailing industry norm for comparable employees and engagements.

The Supplier shall ensure that, unless the University agrees otherwise in writing, none of the Supplier Personnel shall be treated as an employee of the University or any of its Affiliates, and neither the University nor any of its Affiliates shall have any obligation to pay directly any Supplier Personnel’s salary or any other amounts required by law or by contract to be paid to or in respect of any such personnel by his employer.
No approval, acceptance or demand for the replacement of any Supplier Personnel shall excuse the Supplier at any time from its obligation to supply the Services in accordance with this Agreement.

EMPLOYMENT regulations and LIABILITIES In this clause 16: University Parties means the University, its Affiliates or its other contractors including any Replacement Provider; Employment Liabilities means Liabilities arising from: the employment or engagement of any person;

the termination of such employment or engagement; the operation or termination of any collective agreement; any dispute (whether or not the subject of litigation in any court or tribunal)  which relates to such employment or engagement or collective agreement or its termination;
any failure to discharge in full any obligation to inform or consult appropriate representatives or any persons about any matters; or the health and safety of employees or other workers; and

Employment Regulations means, as the context requires the European Union Acquired Rights Directive (Directive 2001/33/EC); any relevant national legislation or legally binding provision implementing that Directive; and any other legislation or binding legal obligation (excluding any contractual obligation) providing for the transfer of employment in the context of service provision arrangements of the type contemplated by this Agreement.

The Parties believe the Employment Regulations do not apply to this Agreement and, accordingly, that there will be no transfer of the contracts of employment of any of: the University Parties’ employees to any Supplier Personnel at any time on or following the commencement of this Agreement or any Services; or

the Supplier Personnel to any of the University Parties during the Contract Term or on or following the expiry or termination of this Agreement or any Services. The Supplier shall indemnify each University Party against all Employment Liabilities which it may incur in connection with:

any claim brought by any Supplier Personnel, including for the termination of his contract of employment; any claims brought against any the University Party by their employees or former employees which arises from any act or omission of any Supplier Personnel; or

any contract of employment of, or collective agreement relating to, any Supplier Personnel which is alleged or found to have effect on or after the Commencement Date as if originally made with any the University Party as a result of the Employment Regulations, whereupon the University Party may terminate such contract or agreement.

In respect of any Supplier Personnel who the University believes may transfer under the Employment Regulations to a the University Party, the Supplier shall promptly provide to the University and the relevant the University Party the following, if requested by the University:

access to and copies of such Supplier Personnel’s employment records as the University reasonably requests; details of such Supplier Personnel’s age, date of commencement of employment or engagement, gender, status (including whether he is employed, self-employed, a subcontractor, consultant or agency worker), contractual notice period and any other terms relating to termination of employment, wages, salaries or profit sharing arrangements, employment related benefits, any outstanding or potential contractual, statutory or other liabilities (including in respect of personal injury claims), long term sickness absence, parental leave, maternity leave or other authorised long term absence; and

copies of all other relevant documents including contract(s) of employment. The Supplier represents, warrants and undertakes that any information provided under clause 16.4 will be true, complete and accurate. This clause 16.5 shall be enforceable at any time (including after the expiry or termination of this Agreement) by any the University Party to whom it has been provided.

PROPERTY AND EQUIPMENT The Supplier shall provide all such materials and facilities as are necessary for the proper and efficient performance of the Supplier’s obligations under this Agreement save for any materials and facilities that the University agrees in writing to provide.

The Supplier shall not use any item of the University Property without first obtaining the University’s written approval. Ownership of, and title to, the University Property shall remain vested in the University and the Supplier shall have no right, title or interest in or to any part of the University Property other than the right to use it in accordance with this Agreement. The Supplier shall only use the University Property to supply the Services.

The Supplier shall obtain the University’s prior written authority before removing any the University Property from the site where it is located. The Supplier shall return any the University Property immediately to that site (or as otherwise directed by the University) upon completion of the applicable Services, upon the expiry of the University’s approval or upon termination or expiry of this Agreement, whichever occurs first.

Whilst in the Supplier’s possession or control: the University Property shall be at the risk of the Supplier until returned and the Supplier shall take appropriate measures to ensure its security and condition; and

the Supplier shall take good care of the University Property and maintain it in accordance with the University’s instructions. All equipment, tools, systems, cabling and facilities provided by or on behalf of the Supplier and used directly or indirectly in the supply of the Services (Supplier Equipment) shall be entirely at the risk of the Supplier.

Save as this Agreement may otherwise expressly require, the Supplier shall be responsible for the proper maintenance and use of all Supplier Equipment. CONTRACT MANAGEMENT On or before the Commencement Date, the Supplier shall appoint the Supplier’s Contract Manager and communicate the individual’s name and contact details in writing to the University. The Supplier’s Contract Manager shall be responsible for ensuring the effective supply of the Services and proper liaison with the University (and have appropriate authority in those respects).

Any instruction or direction in connection with the Services given to the Supplier’s Contract Manager (or his deputy) shall be deemed to be given to the Supplier. On or before the Commencement Date, the University shall appoint the University’s Contract Manager and communicate the individual’s name and contact details in writing to the Supplier. The University’s Contract Manager shall act as the lead point of contact on behalf of the University for the supply of the Services and shall be responsible for proper liaison with the Supplier.

The Contract Managers shall meet (at the University’s Premises unless the Parties agree otherwise) at least once every quarter (and at any time on request from either Party) to discuss and review matters relating to the operation of this Agreement.

RECORDS, REPORTS and audit The Supplier shall keep complete, accurate and up to date records of all time spent, materials used and principal activities carried out, and other material information generated in connection with this Agreement. This must include all transactions which relate in any way to this Agreement or to the Services supplied under it. Such records shall be retained by the Supplier for inspection by the University for 7 years from the period to which they relate or such other period as the University may advise in writing.
The Supplier shall (at no cost to the University): provide to the University such reports, in such format and at such frequency, as may be reasonably requested by the University;

in addition to its obligations under clause 13.1 and Schedule 2, provide to the University such information, materials and explanations (at the time or times specified by the University) as may be requested by the University to enable the University to monitor the performance of the Supplier’s obligations under this Agreement; and

provide to the University copies of the records referred to in clause 19.1. The University, its authorised advisers, other representatives and any regulatory body may audit: the compliance of the Supplier and of each of the Supplier Personnel with the terms of this Agreement (including compliance with Applicable the University Policies); and

the accuracy of the Supplier’s invoicing of the Charges payable by the University under this Agreement. For the purpose of facilitating an audit under clause 19.3, the Supplier shall provide to the University (including its authorised employees), its authorised advisers and other representatives, and any regulatory body, on request (at no cost to the University):

reasonable access to the records referred to in clause 19.1; reasonable access to all relevant information, premises, data, employees, agents, subcontractors and assets at all locations at which the same are present (or may reasonably be expected to be present), including locations from which obligations of the Supplier are being or have been carried out (but not to information which the Supplier is obliged to keep confidential unless such information is required to verify the records referred to in clause 19.1 or items provided under clause 19.2 and not to information which is legally privileged and/or subject to litigation privilege); and

all reasonable assistance in carrying out any audit. For the purpose of complying with this clause 19, the Supplier shall promptly and efficiently give the University (including its authorised employees), its authorised advisers, other representatives and any regulatory body any assistance they reasonably require and follow their instructions with regard to such assistance. The Supplier shall also ensure that it maintains the records referred to in clause 19.1 in a manner that enables them to be viewed without disclosing any information access to which may be withheld under clause 19.4.2.

Where any monitoring, inspection or audit identifies: any overpayment by the University, the Supplier shall immediately repay the overpayment; or any areas where the Supplier is not complying with this Agreement, the Supplier shall immediately rectify such failure and take all necessary steps to ensure its future compliance with this Agreement,

and the Supplier shall bear all the costs of the monitoring, inspection or audit and shall (at no cost to the University) facilitate the University making and retaining copies of any information, records, documents and data identified as relevant from any audit.

Any inspection or audit, or failure to inspect or audit, shall not in any way relieve the Supplier from its obligations under this Agreement. The provisions of this clause 19 shall remain in full force and effect for 7 years after this Agreement expires or terminates (or, in the case of clause 19.1, such other period as the University may advise under that clause).

ACCESS TO PREMISES Access to the University’s Premises shall only be given to the extent necessary for the supply of the Services. The University reserves the right (acting reasonably) to refuse any Supplier Personnel access to the University's Premises.

If the University permits the Supplier Personnel to access the University’s Premises, the Supplier shall ensure that whilst on the University’s Premises the Supplier Personnel: comply with the University’s health and safety and security procedures and all relevant Applicable the University Policies; and

produce suitable identification on request, and the University reserves the right to remove any Supplier Personnel from the University’s Premises if they fail to comply with these requirements. SUBCONTRACTING The Supplier shall not subcontract or delegate the performance of any of its obligations under this Agreement without the University’s prior written consent.

BUSINESS CONTINUITY AND DISASTER RECOVERY The Supplier shall ensure that it has in place at all times a Business Continuity Plan, prepared and maintained in accordance with Good Industry Practice, detailing the steps, actions and procedures to be implemented to ensure that the University continues to receive the Services in accordance with the Service Levels, and any adverse effect on the University is minimised, if any situation occurs (whether or not as a result of any acts or omissions of the Supplier and whether or not a Force Majeure Event) that materially adversely impacts on the Supplier's ability to supply the Services or is likely to do so (a Supply Threat). The Supplier shall at all times have in place processes and procedures to identify a Supply Threat and shall immediately (at no cost to the University) implement the Business Continuity Plan if a Supply Threat occurs and as otherwise required by this Agreement.

The Supplier shall review the current Business Continuity Plan, and its related processes and procedures, regularly, and at least every 6 months, and shall update them where necessary to take account of any increased risk of a Supply Threat or any change in Good Industry Practice.
The Supplier shall provide a copy of the Business Continuity Plan to the University on request and shall in any event notify the University of any changes made to it.

The Supplier shall test all aspects of the Business Continuity Plan, and its related processes and procedures, regularly and in any event annually to ensure that they are robust and suitable. The Supplier shall give the University the opportunity to witness tests being carried out and shall provide to the University, within 1 month after each test, a comprehensive written report setting out the results of each test if requested by the University.

The Supplier shall train, and ensure that such training is up-to-date for, each of the Supplier Personnel in relation to risk management and the Business Continuity Plan to ensure it can be implemented efficiently.

The Supplier shall impose upon each of its subcontractors duties analogous to those of the Supplier under this clause 22 to ensure they are able to identify and take appropriate measures to address Supply Threats.

Unless otherwise agreed in Schedule 3, all activities of the Supplier in connection with this clause 22 shall be undertaken at no cost to the University. FORCE MAJEURE A Party (the Affected Party) shall not be liable to the other Party or be in breach for any delay or failure to perform any of its obligations under this Agreement that is caused by a Force Majeure Event provided it complies with the requirements of this clause 23.

On the occurrence of a Force Majeure Event the Affected Party shall give immediate notice to the other Party’s Contract Manager, stating the nature of the Force Majeure Event, how it is affecting the performance of its obligations, the date it began to affect its performance, the estimated period during which its performance will be affected and the action it has taken and proposes to take to mitigate its effects. The Parties shall then consult with each other and take reasonable steps to agree appropriate terms to mitigate the effects of the Force Majeure Event and facilitate continued performance of this Agreement. The Affected Party shall provide a daily update on the information provided under this clause 23.2.

The Affected Party shall mitigate (and whilst it continues, shall continue to mitigate) the effects of the Force Majeure Event on its performance in accordance with Good Industry Practice including by implementing the Business Continuity Plan.  The Supplier shall continue to perform obligations which are not affected by the Force Majeure Event.

Where the Supplier is the Affected Party it shall ensure that it does not, in the allocation of available resources, treat any other customer more favourably than the University. The Affected Party shall notify the other Party as soon as practicable after the Force Majeure Event ceases to affect its performance. Following such notification any terms agreed under clause 23.2 shall cease to apply and the Affected Party shall recommence performance of its duties in all respects in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

If the performance of all or a material part of the Supplier’s obligations under this Agreement is hindered, delayed or prevented by a Force Majeure Event for a continuous period of 30days OR 30days in aggregate over any 6 consecutive month period, the University may terminate this Agreement by giving 30 days’ written notice to the Supplier.  The Supplier shall have no right to terminate this Agreement as a result of a Force Majeure Event.

The Supplier shall not charge the University for Services that are not supplied in accordance with this Agreement because of a Force Majeure Event or for additional work carried out by the Supplier to overcome the effects of a Force Majeure Event unless and to the extent that the University instructs the Supplier in writing to carry out exceptional additional work to overcome the Force Majeure Event.  In those circumstances, and provided that it has approved them in advance, the University shall reimburse the Supplier’s costs for the additional work.

CHARGES In consideration of the Supplier supplying the Services, the University shall pay the Charges on and subject to the terms of this Agreement. In respect of Goods, the Supplier shall invoice the University on or at any time after completion of Delivery. In respect of Services, the Supplier shall invoice the University on completion of the Services.

The Charges together with any applicable VAT and any interest payable under clause 26.11, are the only amounts payable by the University for the Services. The Supplier shall perform all its other obligations under this Agreement at no cost to the University (unless expressly stated otherwise in this Agreement).

Unless Schedule 3 states otherwise, the Supplier shall be solely responsible for all expenses it incurs in supplying the Services. To the extent Schedule 3 allows the reimbursement of expenses the Supplier shall use all reasonable endeavours to keep them to a minimum and in order to be recoverable an expense must:

be reasonably and properly incurred in connection with the Services; not exceed in aggregate any total specified in Schedule 3; be supported by a detailed invoice or receipt evidencing that it has been incurred and paid; and

be invoiced to the University at cost without any mark-up. benchmarking – not used PAYMENT Subject to clauses 26.2, 26.3 and 26.8, the University shall pay each Valid Invoice within 30 days of the end of the month in which the Valid Invoice is received.

If any of the Supplier’s obligations under this Agreement have not been performed fully in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, the University may refuse to pay any outstanding or due payments until they have been properly performed.
The University shall not be obliged to pay any amount, invoice (whether a Valid Invoice or otherwise) or portion of it in respect of which the University has not issued a purchase order.
A Valid Invoice means an invoice submitted in accordance with Schedule 3 in such form and by such method as specified by the University and that includes: a reference to this Agreement;

the  number to which the invoice relates; a short description of the Services supplied; the itemised Charges and the period to which the invoice relates; where the Supplier is entitled to the reimbursement of expenses, itemised details of the expenses and their approval by the University;

the Supplier’s VAT registration number or equivalent; the applicable VAT rate and amount; and any other requirements made known by the University to the Supplier in writing. If the University receives an invoice which is not a Valid Invoice it may, without prejudice to clause 26.8, notify the Supplier of the relevant error or omission and shall not be obliged to pay that invoice.  The Supplier shall then issue to the University a correct Valid Invoice and a credit note correcting the error or omission and the correct Valid Invoice shall have effect as if the previous invoice had never been issued.
Each invoice should be submitted by the Supplier in such form and by such method as specified by the University. All payments due under this Agreement shall be made in pounds sterling.
If the University receives an invoice which it reasonably believes includes a sum which is not properly due: the University shall notify the Supplier in writing as soon as reasonably practicable;
the University's failure to pay the disputed invoice shall not be deemed to be a breach of this Agreement and no interest shall be due in relation to the disputed invoice;

if the Supplier wishes to be paid the balance of the invoice which is not in dispute it shall issue to the University a credit note in respect of the invoice in dispute and a Valid Invoice for only the undisputed amount which the University shall pay in accordance with clause 26.1; and

once the Dispute has been resolved: if it is determined that the amount properly payable is less than the amount included in the disputed invoice, the Supplier shall issue to the University a credit note in respect of the disputed invoice (unless it has already done so under clause 26.8.3) and shall issue to the University a Valid Invoice for the amount (if any) properly payable (less any amount already invoiced under clause 26.8.3) which the University shall pay in accordance with clause 26.1; or

if it is determined that the amount properly payable is equal to or greater than the amount included in the disputed invoice, (subject to 26.8.4(c)) the University shall pay the disputed invoice in accordance with clause 26.1 (but as if it had been dated on resolution of the dispute) and the Supplier shall issue to the University a Valid Invoice for any additional amount properly payable, which the University shall pay in accordance with clause 26.1; or

where clause 26.8.4(b) would apply but the Supplier has issued a credit note and Valid Invoice under clause 26.8.3, the Supplier shall issue to the University a Valid Invoice for the additional amount properly payable, which the University shall pay in accordance with clause 26.1.

The Supplier may not suspend or reduce the supply of the Services as a result of any overdue, undisputed or disputed invoice or other sums owed by the University. Payment by the University of any invoice will not be deemed to be approval or acceptance by the University of the Services or other matters in respect of which the invoice is issued and will be without prejudice to the University’s rights and remedies under this Agreement or at law in respect of any failure or delay on the part of the Supplier to perform its obligations.

If a Party fails to make any payment due to the other Party under this Agreement within 10 Business Days following notice from the other Party that the amount has not been paid by the due date for payment, then the other Party may charge the defaulting Party interest on the overdue amount at the rate per annum of 3% over the 1-month LIBOR (London InterBank Offer Rate) in respect of the currency in which the payment is due as at 11am London time on the date on which the payment becomes overdue. Such interest shall accrue daily from the date on which the invoice should have been paid under clause 26.1 until the date of actual payment of the overdue amount, whether before or after judgment. The defaulting Party shall pay the interest following receipt of an invoice from the other Party in respect of the interest charged.
SET-OFF All amounts due under this Agreement shall be paid in full without any set-off, counterclaim, deduction or withholding (other than any deduction or withholding of tax as required by law).

employer’s liability insurance for the minimum amount of five million pounds sterling (£5,000,000) per event; public liability insurance for the minimum amount of five million pounds sterling (£5,000,000); professional indemnity, errors or omissions or equivalent insurance for the minimum amount of five million pounds sterling (£5,000,000) per event; and

all other insurances required by any Applicable Laws, in each case, with a reputable insurer and without any excess that is unreasonable or unusual for the type of insurance. The Supplier shall maintain the insurances referred to in clause 39.1 in force for the Contract Term and, in the case of the insurances referred to in clause 39.1.3 and clause 39.1.4, for 6 years after this Agreement has expired or terminated.

The Supplier shall not knowingly do or permit anything to be done which would render the insurance policies referred to in clause 39.1 void or voidable, or which would permit the insurer to reject, diminish or delay any claim under the insurance policy.

Within 10 Business Days of a request by the University, the Supplier shall provide evidence of the insurances which it is obliged to maintain under clause 39.1. If the Supplier fails to comply with its obligations in relation to insurance the University may take out such insurance in its own name and recover the cost of doing so from the Supplier.

Modern Slavery The Supplier agrees with the University that it shall, and that it shall procure that the Supplier Personnel and any other person who performs services and/or supplies goods within the Supplier’s supply chain for the Supplier in relation to this Agreement shall:

comply with all Applicable Law relating to slavery and human trafficking (Anti-Slavery Requirements) including the Modern Slavery Act 2015; not take or knowingly permit any action to be taken that would or might cause or lead the University to be in violation of any Anti-Slavery Requirements; and

at the University’s request, provide the University with any reasonable assistance to enable it to perform any activity required by any regulatory body for the purpose of complying with Anti-Slavery Requirements.

The Supplier represents, warrants and undertakes to the University that neither it nor any other person in its supply chain (including those described in clause 40.1) uses trafficked, bonded, child or forced labour or has attempted to use trafficked, bonded, child or forced labour within its supply chain.

The Supplier agrees that in addition to the University’s termination rights set out elsewhere in this Agreement, the University may (without prejudice to any other right available to it) immediately terminate this Agreement in the event of any breach of this clause 40 by the Supplier in which case the Supplier shall not be entitled to any compensation or to any further payments or remuneration.
The University shall not be required to make any payment to the Supplier that might otherwise be due from the University in respect of this Agreement if the Supplier has breached this clause 40.

The Supplier shall indemnify the University from and against any and all Liabilities suffered or incurred by the University or for which the University may become liable arising out of or in connection with any breach of this clause 40, whether or not this Agreement has been terminated.

anti corruption The Supplier will not, and nor will any of its officers, employees, shareholders, representatives or agents (Associated Parties), directly or indirectly, either in private business dealings or in dealings with the public sector, offer, give or agree to offer or give (either itself or in agreement with others) any payment, gift or other advantage with respect to any matters which are the subject of this Agreement which:

would violate Applicable Law; is intended to, or does, influence or reward any person for acting in breach of an expectation of good faith, impartiality or trust, or which it would otherwise be improper for the recipient to accept;

is made to or for a public official with the intention of influencing them and obtaining or retaining an advantage in the conduct of business; or a reasonable person would otherwise consider to be unethical, illegal or improper,
(in this clause 40, a Corrupt Act). The Supplier represents, warrants and undertakes that: it and its Associated Parties have not engaged in any Corrupt Act prior to the date of this Agreement; and

to the best of its knowledge and belief, neither the Supplier nor any of its Associated Parties has at any time: been found by a court in any jurisdiction to have engaged in any Corrupt Act (or similar conduct);
admitted to having engaged in any Corrupt Act (or similar conduct); or been investigated or been suspected in any jurisdiction of having engaged in any Corrupt Act (or similar conduct).

The Supplier further agrees: to provide any information as the University may reasonably require by notice in writing in order to monitor the Supplier’s and its Associated Parties’ compliance with its obligations under clause 41.1; and

to notify the University immediately in writing if, at any time, it or any of its Associated Parties become aware of a breach of clause 41.1 or that any of the representations, warranties and undertakings set out at clause 41.2 are no longer correct.

ASSIGNMENT Save as provided in clause 42.2, neither Party may assign, transfer, charge, create a trust over or otherwise deal in this Agreement or any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement (or purport to do so) without the prior written consent of the other Party. the Affiliate agrees to be bound by the terms of this Agreement; and the liability of the Supplier under this Agreement will continue to be subject to the same limitations, exceptions and exclusions under this Agreement and such liability shall not be increased by reason of the novation or assignment.

RIGHTS OF THIRD PARTIES This Agreement does not create any right or benefit enforceable by any person not a Party to it except for: a person who under clause 42 is a permitted successor or assignee of the rights or benefits of a Party that may enforce such rights or benefits;

the University’s Affiliates; and any Replacement Provider or other the University contractor, in respect of the rights given it in clause 16. DISPUTE RESOLUTION The Parties shall procure that the Contract Managers shall meet and use their reasonable endeavours to resolve any Dispute. If the Dispute is not resolved between the Contract Managers within 10 Business Days of receipt of a written request from either Party (Dispute Notice), the Dispute shall be referred to a senior executive from each of the Parties. If the Dispute is not resolved within 30 Business Days from the date of receipt of the Dispute Notice, either Party may by written notice to the other (Mediation Notice) elect to attempt to settle the Dispute by mediation in accordance with clause 46.3.

Notwithstanding clause 46.1, each of the Parties may by notice require that a Dispute be referred directly to a senior executive from each of the Parties at any time without the Contract Managers first attempting to resolve the Dispute or a Dispute Notice having been issued.

If a Mediation Notice is given under clause 46.1 the following provisions shall apply: the Parties shall promptly refer the Dispute to mediation under the Model Mediation Procedure (MMP) of the Centre for Effective Dispute Resolution (CEDR) for the time being in force;

each Party shall, immediately on such referral, co-operate fully and promptly with CEDR and the mediator and shall do all such acts and sign all such documents as CEDR or the mediator may reasonably require to give effect to such mediation, including an agreement in, or substantially in, the form of CEDR's Model Mediation Agreement for the time being in force; and

to the extent not provided for by the MMP, the mediation shall be conducted by a sole mediator (which shall not exclude the presence of a pupil mediator) agreed between the Parties or, in default of Agreement, appointed by CEDR.

Save in relation to injunctive relief, neither Party may commence any court proceedings in relation to any Dispute until it has attempted to settle the Dispute in accordance with clauses 46.1 or clause 46.2.  For the avoidance of doubt, the commencement of a mediation under clause 46.3 will not prevent the Parties commencing or continuing court proceedings.

Subject to clause 46.4, if and to the extent that the Parties do not resolve the Dispute or any related issue in accordance with clauses 46.1 to 46.3, either Party may commence court proceedings in respect of such unresolved Dispute or issue.

SEVERANCE If any provision, or part of a provision, of this Agreement is found by any court or administrative body of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, illegal or unenforceable (a Void Provision):

such invalidity, illegality or unenforceability shall not affect the other provisions of this Agreement, which shall remain in full force and effect; if a Void Provision would be valid, legal and enforceable if some part of it were deleted, that Void Provision shall apply with such modification as may be necessary to make it valid, legal and enforceable;

interpretation In this Schedule, Change Control Note or CCN means the form used by the Parties to set out the details of an agreed Change and which shall be substantially in the form shown at the end of this Schedule.

General principles of the Change Control Procedure This Schedule sets out the rules and procedures for dealing with Changes. The Supplier shall not be entitled to any payment of Charges in respect of any Change unless it complies with the Change Control Procedure.
Under this Change Control Procedure: either Party may request a Change in accordance with paragraph 3; each Party shall respond to a request for a Change in accordance with paragraph 4;

the Parties shall discuss and endeavour to agree Changes in accordance with paragraph 6; any agreed Changes shall be recorded in accordance with paragraph 7; and the Supplier shall implement and report on the progress of Changes in accordance with paragraph 8.

Until a CCN has been signed in accordance with paragraph 7 and unless the Parties agree otherwise in writing: any work undertaken by the Supplier which has not been authorised in accordance with this Change Control Procedure shall be undertaken entirely at its own risk, expense and liability;

the Supplier shall continue to supply the Services in accordance with the existing terms of this Agreement; and any discussions, negotiations or other communications which may take place between the University and the Supplier in connection with any proposed Change shall be without prejudice to each Party’s other rights and obligations under this Agreement.

Change requests Either Party may request a Change by giving notice in writing to the other describing the Change and the reasons for requesting it in sufficient detail to enable the other Party to understand the possible impact of the proposed Change (the Change Request).

Responding to Change Requests If either Party reasonably requires any clarification or further information in order for it to respond to a Change Request, it shall promptly notify the other Party and the relevant time period shall be extended by the time taken by the other Party to provide that clarification or information.

Each Party shall respond to any request for clarification or further information as soon as reasonably practicable. Within 10 Business Days of receiving a Change Request from the University (or at the time of making its own Change Request), the Supplier shall (at no cost to the University) provide an estimate (the Estimate) to the University in writing which set outs:

whether the Change is technically feasible; whether relief from compliance by the Supplier with its obligations under this Agreement is required, including the obligation to meet the Service Levels, during the implementation of the Change;
any impact of the Change on the supply of the Services; a risk assessment and any impact on the Business Continuity Plan; any amendment required to this Agreement as a result of the Change;

any regulatory approvals which are required to make the Change; any proposed amended or new Service Levels applicable to the Change together with all associated changes to Schedule 2; the period within which the Change can be implemented; and

any proposed increase or reduction in the Charges as a result of the Change and evidence that the Supplier has used all reasonable endeavours (including, where practicable, the use of competitive quotes from its suppliers and subcontractors) to minimise any increase in costs and maximise any reduction in costs.

Any relief sought or amendment to this Agreement proposed by the Supplier must be fair and reasonable and in proposing any changes to the Charges in an Estimate, the Supplier will follow the charging principles set out in paragraph 5.

Charging Principles The Parties agree that the financial consequences of a Change shall be dealt with as follows (unless they agree otherwise in writing): if the Change will result in a decrease in the cost of providing the Services or other financial benefit to the Supplier, the Charges shall be reduced by an equitable amount;
any increase in the Charges must be no greater than the direct, reasonable and verifiable costs of implementing the Change and supplying the Services following the implementation of the Change;

if the Change is carried out for other customers of the Supplier, the University shall only bear an equitable proportion of the Supplier’s cost, and where the University proposes a Change in the Services as a result of, or in order to mitigate the effects of, a Service Failure, any increased costs associated with such Change shall be met entirely by the Supplier and there will be no increase in the Charges in such case.
Agreeing Changes As soon as practicable after the University receives the Estimate, the Parties shall discuss and seek to agree the matters set out in the Change Request and the Estimate.

Where required by the University, the Supplier’s Contract Manager (or other authorised representative of the Supplier) shall attend face to face meetings to discuss the proposed Change at dates and locations nominated by the University.

The Supplier shall not unreasonably reject a University proposed Change.  If the Supplier believes it has reasonable grounds for rejecting a University proposed Change, it shall promptly advise the University setting out those grounds in detail.  The University shall reasonably consider such grounds, advise the Supplier of its decision and escalate any issues through the Dispute Resolution Procedure.

If the Contract Managers have not agreed a Change Request and Estimate within 15 Business Days of receipt of the Estimate it shall be deemed to be a Dispute which may be referred to the Dispute Resolution Procedure.

Recording the Agreed Change Where the Parties agree to make a Change under paragraph 6 or following the resolution of a Dispute under the Dispute Resolution Procedure, the Supplier shall promptly prepare 2 copies of a CCN bearing a unique identifying number and recording the approved Change, which a duly authorised representative of the Supplier shall sign and deliver to the University’s Contract Manager for its signature.
Following receipt by the University of a properly completed and signed CCN, a duly authorised representative of the University shall sign both copies and return one copy to the Supplier.

A CCN signed by duly authorised representatives of the University and the Supplier shall constitute a binding and enforceable instrument evidencing the variation of this Agreement to reflect the agreed Change.

Neither Party shall be bound by a Change until it is included in a signed CCN. Implementing and Tracking Changes Following a CCN being signed by both Parties, the Supplier shall implement the Change to which it relates in accordance with the CCN.

The Supplier shall, during the period of implementation, provide the University with a weekly progress update on the status of the implementation of each agreed Change.
